meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the control and regulation of the production, storage, collection and disposal including the treatment, reprocessing and recycling of waste of any class or description, the licensing and registration of places and persons connected with any such activity, the protection and safety of the public in relation to any such activity and to provide for matters incidental thereto.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Waste Disposal Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: analyst (化驗師) means the Government Chemist or any person appointed by the Chief Executive under section 23E(5); (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

def.name: AnimalWaste

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manure or urine of any animal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any dead animal or any part of any dead animal not fit for, or not intended for, human consumption; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any bedding, straw or other waste contaminated by the manure or urine of any animal, (Replaced 58 of 1987 s. 2)

def.continued: but does not include clinical waste; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 2)

subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a public officer authorized under section 23A; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)
chemical waste (化學廢物) means any substance, matter or thing defined as chemical waste by regulations made under section 33; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 3)

def.name: ClinicalWaste
def.leadIn: clinical waste (醫療廢物) means waste consisting of any substance, matter or thing belonging to any of the groups specified in Schedule 8 that is generated in connection with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a dental, medical, nursing or veterinary practice;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: dental, medical, nursing, veterinary, pathological or pharmaceutical research; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: dental;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: medical;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: veterinary; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: pathological,

def.continued: but does not include chemical waste or radioactive waste; (Added 6 of 2006 s. 2)

subsection.def: Code of Practice (工作守則) means any Code of Practice prepared or revised by the Secretary under section 35; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended L.N. 244 of 1989; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

def.name: CollectionAuthority
def.leadIn: collection authority (廢物收集當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to chemical waste and clinical waste, the Director; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other waste, means the Director of FEH and the Director; (Replaced 78 of 1999 s. 7. Amended L.N. 183 of 2000; 25 of 2021 s. 3)

subsection.def: construction waste (建築廢物) means any substance, matter or thing defined as construction waste by regulations made under section 33, but does not include chemical waste; (Added 17 of 2004 s. 2)

def.name: ContainerWaste
def.leadIn: container waste (容器廢物) means a container (whether damaged or not) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: judging by its appearance, is a container specified in column 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 8 to the Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance (Cap. 603); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been abandoned; (Added 13 of 2016 s. 9)

def.name: DesignatedBag
def.leadIn: designated bag (指定袋) means a bag that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is produced by the Director or a person who is authorized to produce it under section 20S(2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: DesignatedLabel
def.leadIn: designated label (指定標籤) means a label that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is produced by the Director or a person who is authorized to produce it under section 20S(2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: designated waste disposal facility (指定廢物處置設施) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Waste Disposal (Designated Waste Disposal Facility) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. L); (Added 17 of 2004 s. 2)
Director (署長) means the Director of Environmental Protection; (Added L.N. 74 of 1986)
Director of FEH (食環署長) means the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

disposal (處置)—(a)in relation to chemical waste and clinical waste, includes treatment, reprocessing and recycling; (Amended 13 of 2016 s. 9)(b)in relation to e-waste, includes storage, treatment, reprocessing and recycling, but does not include repair; and (Amended 13 of 2016 s. 9)(c)in relation to container waste, includes storage, treatment, reprocessing and recycling, but does not include reuse; (Added 13 of 2016 s. 9)

def.name: EnlargedArea
def.leadIn: enlarged area (放大區) means those parts of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a livestock waste prohibition area;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a livestock waste control area; or (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a livestock waste restriction area, (Added 28 of 1994 s. 2)

def.continued: specified in the third column of the Third Schedule by reference to maps identified therein and signed by the Director, an officer of the Environmental Protection Department not below the rank of Environmental Protection Officer or a Chief Environmental Protection Inspector and deposited with the Land Registry, which abut or share a common boundary with one or more livestock waste control areas or one or more livestock waste restriction areas; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 28 of 1994 s. 2)

subsection.def: e-waste (電器廢物) means any electrical equipment or electronic equipment that, judging by its appearance, is an item set out in column 2 of Part 1 of Schedule 6 to the Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance (Cap. 603) and has been abandoned; (Added 3 of 2016 s. 12. Amended 27 of 2023 s. 13)
exempt person (獲豁免的人) means any person or any classes of person specified in the Fourth Schedule; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)
household waste (住戶廢物) means waste produced by a household, and of a kind that is ordinarily produced by a dwelling when occupied as such;
keep (飼養) includes breed, house, tend, look after or control and kept and keeping shall be construed accordingly; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)
lairage (圍欄) means that part of a slaughterhouse or abattoir used for the admission or confinement of animals; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)
livestock (禽畜) means pigs or poultry; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

def.name: LivestockKeeper

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an owner of livestock; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an owner, lessee or occupier or person responsible for the management of livestock premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person keeping livestock or having the custody or possession of livestock; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any former livestock keeper,

def.continued: but does not comprise exclusively any exempt person; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises, buildings, land or land covered by water owned, leased or occupied by a livestock keeper, his dependants or employees for the purpose of keeping livestock and any dwelling-place and ancillary buildings or structures connected therewith;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other premises in or on which livestock are kept other than any premises comprising any abattoir, slaughterhouse, market, fresh provision shop, lairage or hatchery in which poultry of not more than 12 days old are kept; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any former livestock premises; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

subsection.def: livestock waste (禽畜廢物) means, subject to section 2A, animal waste produced by, or connected with, livestock; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 28 of 1994 s. 2)

livestock waste control area (禽畜廢物管制區) means a livestock waste control area specified in the second column of the Second Schedule by reference to maps identified therein and signed by the Director, an officer of the Environmental Protection Department not below the rank of Environmental Protection Officer or a Chief Environmental Protection Inspector and deposited with the Land Registry; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 28 of 1994 s. 2)

livestock waste prohibition area (禽畜廢物禁制區) means a livestock waste prohibition area specified in the second column of the First Schedule by reference to maps identified therein and signed by the Director, an officer of the Environmental Protection Department not below the rank of Environmental Protection Officer or a Chief Environmental Protection Inspector and deposited with the Land Registry; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 28 of 1994 s. 2)

livestock waste restriction area (禽畜廢物限制區) means a livestock waste restriction area specified in column 2 of the Fifth Schedule by reference to maps identified therein and signed by the Director, an officer of the Environmental Protection Department not below the rank of Environmental Protection Officer or a Chief Environmental Protection Inspector and deposited with the Land Registry; (Added 28 of 1994 s. 2)

livestock waste treatment plant (禽畜廢物處理裝置) means a waste treatment plant at which livestock waste is treated by biological, chemical, physical or other means or any combination thereof in accordance with regulations made under section 33; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

def.name: MunicipalSolidWaste
def.leadIn: municipal solid waste (都市固體廢物) means any waste except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: chemical waste;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: clinical waste; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: construction waste; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

subsection.def: poultry (家禽) means chickens, ducks, geese, pigeons and quail; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

private lot (私人地段) means a piece or parcel of ground held under a Government lease and identified by a lot number as defined by regulation 2 of the Land Registration Regulations (Cap. 128 sub. leg. A); (Added 19 of 2013 s. 3)

def.name: RefuseCollectionPoint
def.leadIn: refuse collection point (垃圾收集站) means a place where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: municipal solid waste is collected and removed by, or on behalf of, the Director of FEH; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sign prescribed under section 20X(1)(a) is exhibited in the way prescribed under that section; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of a livestock waste control area, the date shown in the third column of the Second Schedule in respect of that area; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)

subsection.def: scheduled facility (附表設施)—see section 2 of the Waste Disposal (Refuse Transfer Station) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. M); (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology; (Added 78 of 1999 s. 7. Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)
slaughterhouse (屠房) and abattoir (屠場) has the meaning assigned to it in the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132); (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2)
specified bin (指明桶箱) means a container that, in the way prescribed under section 20X(1)(c), exhibits the sign prescribed under that section; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)
street waste (街道廢物) means dust, dirt, rubbish, mud, road scapings or filth, but does not include human excretal matter;

trade waste (行業廢物) means waste from any trade, manufacture or business, but does not include animal waste, chemical waste, clinical waste or construction waste; (Replaced 17 of 2004 s. 2. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 2)

waste (廢物) means any substance or article which is abandoned and includes animal waste, chemical waste, clinical waste, construction waste, e-waste, container waste, household waste, livestock waste, street waste and trade waste; (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 3; 17 of 2004 s. 2; 6 of 2006 s. 2; 3 of 2016 s. 12; 13 of 2016 s. 9)
waste collection licence (廢物收集牌照) means a licence under section 10;
waste disposal authority (廢物處置當局), in respect of all classes of waste, means the Director; (Replaced L.N. 74 of 1986)
waste disposal licence (廢物處置牌照) means a licence under section 16;

waste treatment plant (廢物處理裝置) means a plant at which waste is treated for the purpose of removing therefrom (wholly or in part) pollutants contained therein; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 2. Amended 25 of 2021 s. 3)

waste vehicle in Government service (政府用廢物車輛) means a vehicle (whether or not equipped with a device designed for compacting waste carried on the vehicle) that is being used by, or on behalf of, the Director of FEH for removing municipal solid waste and disposing of it at a scheduled facility; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

def.name: WasteVehicleInPrivateUsewithCompactor
def.leadIn: waste vehicle in private use (with compactor) (設有壓縮裝置非政府用廢物車輛) means a vehicle (other than a waste vehicle in Government service) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being used for removing municipal solid waste and disposing of it at a scheduled facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has an enclosed compartment equipped with a device designed for compacting waste within the compartment; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

def.name: WasteVehicleInPrivateUsewithoutCompactor
def.leadIn: waste vehicle in private use (without compactor) (不設壓縮裝置非政府用廢物車輛) means a vehicle (other than a waste vehicle in Government service) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being used for removing municipal solid waste and disposing of it at a scheduled facility; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not equipped with a device designed for compacting waste carried on the vehicle; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 3)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance any substance or article which is discarded or otherwise dealt with as waste shall be presumed to be waste until the contrary is proved.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Offences
section.content: In any proceeding for an offence under this Ordinance or any regulation made under section 33, livestock waste means any waste generated or produced in or on livestock premises or any premises where livestock have been kept at any time within 60 days before the waste escapes or is discharged therefrom.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Preparation of draft waste disposal plans

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, and having regard to that Council’s views, prepare draft plans showing— (Amended L.N. 165 of 1984; 8 of 1986 s. 8; L.N. 57 of 1994)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the arrangements made or proposed to be made for the collection and disposal of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all solid and semi-solid wastes other than those which may be discharged into the atmosphere as particulates or discharged into water as solids suspended in effluents; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such other wastes, or classes of waste, as may be prescribed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all existing and proposed waste disposal sites and the methods of waste disposal used or to be used at each site.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Secretary has prepared a draft waste disposal plan under subsection (1) he shall publish in the Gazette a notice in English and in Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: giving particulars of the places and times at which a copy of the draft plan may be inspected by the public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the time within which and the manner in which representations concerning the draft plan may be made.

subsection.content: Where the Secretary publishes a notice under subsection (1) he shall not later than 7 days thereafter publish a copy of the notice in 3 issues of 1 English language and of 2 Chinese language newspapers.

A copy of the draft plan shall be available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Secretary thinks fit for a period of 45 days from the date of publication of a notice under subsection (1) and during the hours when those offices are normally open to the public.
The Secretary shall supply a copy of the draft plan upon payment of such fee as may be prescribed.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Representations concerning draft waste disposal plan

subsection.content: Any person wishing to make representations concerning a draft waste disposal plan may, within a period of 45 days from the date of publication of a notice under section 3(2), submit to the Secretary his written representations.
The Secretary shall consider such representations and may make any change to the draft plan which he considers appropriate in consequence of the representations.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Submission of draft waste disposal plan to Chief Executive in Council
section.leadIn: The Secretary shall, within 12 months from the last day of the period during which representations may be made, submit the draft waste disposal plan to the Chief Executive in Council for approval and shall at the same time submit— (Amended 78 of 1999 s. 7; 21 of 2024 s. 78)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a schedule of representations made under section 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a schedule of the changes made by him to the draft waste disposal plan in consequence of the representations.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive in Council upon submission of draft waste disposal plan

subsection.leadIn: Upon submission of a draft waste disposal plan under section 5, the Chief Executive in Council shall— (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve the draft plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to approve it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refer it back to the Secretary for further consideration and amendment.

subsection.content: Where the Chief Executive in Council has either approved or refused to approve a draft waste disposal plan, the Secretary shall as soon as possible after such approval or refusal give notice thereof in the Gazette of such approval or refusal; and where the draft plan has been approved he shall also publish in the Gazette a notice declaring the plan to be a waste disposal plan. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

A copy of any waste disposal plan shall be available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Secretary thinks fit during the hours when the offices are normally open to the public.
The Secretary shall supply a copy of any waste disposal plan upon payment of such fee as may be prescribed.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Revision of waste disposal plans
section.content: The Secretary may from time to time revise any waste disposal plan and sections 3, 4, 5 and 6 shall apply to any revision in like manner as they apply to a waste disposal plan.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Collection authorities and waste disposal authorities to have regard to waste disposal plans
section.content: In discharging their duties and functions under this Ordinance, the collection authorities and the waste disposal authorities shall have regard to the waste disposal plans.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Provision of collection and scavenging services
section.leadIn: Subject to this Part, the collection authority may provide services for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the removal and disposal of household waste, street waste, trade waste, livestock waste and animal waste; (Amended 58 of 1987 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cleansing and emptying of pail latrines;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the desludging of aqua privies and septic tanks; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the removal and disposal of excretal matter from such latrines, privies and tanks.

section.name: s9A
section.heading: Collection of chemical waste or clinical waste in special circumstances
section.leadIn: The collection authority may provide services for the collection and removal of chemical waste or clinical waste—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in response to an accident or emergency involving such waste; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in circumstances where the authority thinks that it would not be reasonably practicable to arrange for such waste to be collected or removed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the holder of a licence under section 10(5) for providing services for the collection or removal of such waste; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized pursuant to any regulation made under section 33(1)(ca) to provide services for the collection or removal of such waste.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Licensing of collection and scavenging services

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 9, the collection authority may, by licence, permit any person to provide services for all or any of the matters referred to in that section.

The Director as collection authority may by licence permit any person to provide services for the collection or removal of chemical waste or clinical waste. (Added 86 of 1991 s. 4. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 4)
The fee for a licence referred to in subsection (1) or (5) and in respect of which the Director is the collection authority shall be the prescribed fee. (Added 86 of 1991 s. 4)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Prohibition of collection of waste unless licensed or authorized

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 12, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collection authority provides any services under section 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person is permitted to provide any services specified in section 9 pursuant to a licence under section 10(1),

subsection.continued: any other person (other than the holder of a licence under section 10(1) for provision of the services) who provides the services commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: A person who provides services for the collection or removal of chemical waste or clinical waste, other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holder of a licence under section 10(5) for provision of the services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person authorized to provide the services pursuant to any regulation made under section 33(1)(ca),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Occupier of building may remove household waste in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 11, it shall not be an offence under that section for an occupier of any building, or any person responsible for the management of any building, to remove household waste from any building if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collection authority or any person holding a waste collection licence neglects or fails for a period of 48 hours to remove household waste for any building in respect of which the authority or person provides that service under section 9 or 10; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no such service for the removal of household waste is provided by a collection authority or a person holding a waste collection licence.

subsection.content: Any waste removed under subsection (1) may be disposed of in any way permitted by law.
Nothing in this section shall derogate from any regulations made under section 15 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132). (Amended 10 of 1986 s. 32(1))

section.name: s13
section.heading: Collection of trade waste, livestock waste or animal waste and removal of livestock waste and animal waste

subsection.content: If the collection authority is requested by the owner or occupier or person responsible for the management of any building or land to remove any trade waste, livestock waste or animal waste, the collection authority may remove it, and may recover from the person requesting the removal a fee not exceeding the cost of removal and disposal.

The collection authority may by notice served on the owner or occupier or person responsible for the management of any stable, cow-house, pigsty, kennel, poultry farm or similar establishment require the removal from the premises of livestock waste, animal waste, bedding, straw or other waste.

If, where a notice has been served under subsection (2), any person, who is required by the notice to remove any livestock waste, animal waste, bedding, straw or other waste from any premises specified in the notice, fails to comply with that requirement, he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $10,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 4; E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Property in collected waste, etc.
section.content: All household waste, street waste, trade waste, livestock waste, animal waste and any matter obtained from the cleansing and emptying of pail latrines and the desludging of aqua privies and septic tanks, collected by the collection authority in the operation of any service provided under section 9 or section 13 or collected by a person licensed by a collection authority under section 10 shall be the property of the Government and may be sold or disposed of by the collection authority in a manner that authority thinks fit.

subsection.content: No person (other than an exempt person) shall keep livestock in or on any premises in a livestock waste prohibition area specified in the second column of the First Schedule after the relevant date specified opposite thereto in the third column thereof.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a first offence, to a fine at level 6; or (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in addition, if the offence is a continuing one, to a fine of $5,000 for each day on which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 5)

subsection.content: No person (other than an exempt person) shall keep livestock in or on any premises in a livestock waste control area specified in the second column of the Second Schedule after the relevant date specified opposite thereto in the third column thereof unless that person complies with regulations made under section 33 in relation to the collection, storage, treatment and disposal of livestock waste generated or produced in or on livestock premises.

Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $5,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 6; E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: No person (other than an exempt person) shall keep livestock in or on any premises in a livestock waste restriction area specified in column 2 of the Fifth Schedule after the relevant date specified opposite thereto in column 3 thereof unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is authorized in writing so to do by the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he holds a valid licence so to do issued by the Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation under the Public Health (Animals and Birds) Ordinance (Cap. 139), (Amended L.N. 331 of 1999)

subsection.continued: and he complies with regulations made under section 33 in relation to the collection, storage, treatment and disposal of livestock waste generated or produced in or on livestock premises.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $5,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Where any livestock is seized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of an alleged contravention of section 15A(1) or 15AA and no person is subsequently convicted of an offence under that section in relation to that livestock; or (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 8; 80 of 1997 s. 102)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in contravention of section 15E(1),

subsection.continued: and whether or not such livestock is subsequently released to the owner of the livestock or the livestock keeper (other than the owner) on the order of a magistrate or otherwise, the owner or person in lawful possession of that livestock may within 6 months of such seizure or later criminal proceedings (if any) apply to the District Court or the Court of First Instance for compensation for any loss arising out of the seizure, which loss shall be recoverable as a civil debt due from the Government, and such application may be begun by motion. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: An award of compensation under subsection (1) shall be an award of such sum, if any, as is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case, including the conduct and comparative blameworthiness of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the livestock;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the livestock keeper (other than the owner);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person in charge of the livestock premises in or on which the livestock was kept at the time of seizure; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director and any authorized officers concerned.

subsection.content: A court which convicts any person of an offence under section 15, 15A or 15AA may, in addition to any other order that it makes, order the forfeiture of any livestock in respect of which the offence is committed.

subsection.leadIn: Where livestock in respect of which a person is convicted of an offence under section 15, 15A or 15AA is sold or otherwise disposed of, whether under section 15D(2) or otherwise, a court which subsequently convicts any person who is the owner of the livestock of an offence under section 15, 15A or 15AA may order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a sale under section 15D(2), the forfeiture of a sum of money equal to the balance referred to in section 15D(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the forfeiture of a sum of money equal to the value of the livestock at the time of its disposal.

subsection.content: Subject to section 15E, the Director may seize, detain and dispose of any livestock that he has reasonable cause to suspect is being kept in contravention of section 15, 15A or 15AA. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 10)

Subject to subsection (4), where livestock is seized under subsection (1) the livestock may be sold by the Director, whether or not any person is prosecuted for, or convicted of, an offence under section 15, 15A or 15AA, and the proceeds of sale dealt with under subsection (3). (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Where livestock is sold under subsection (2) the proceeds of sale shall be used to pay any costs incurred in the seizure, detention and sale and the balance (if any)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be paid to the person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: submits in writing to the Director within 28 days of the sale a claim to such livestock; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: proves to the satisfaction of the Director that he was the owner of the livestock at the time it was seized; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it is not paid under paragraph (a), shall be forfeited unless, within 2 months of the sale, a court otherwise orders upon an application made by the Director or any person who has an interest in the livestock.

subsection.content: Where livestock seized under subsection (1) is of no commercial value or the sale of the livestock is for any reason not considered by the Director to be practicable the Director may order the livestock to be destroyed or otherwise disposed of in such manner as he thinks fit.

The Director shall not under section 15D(1) seize any livestock that he has reasonable cause to suspect is being kept in contravention of section 15A(1) or 15AA unless he has first served on the owner of the livestock or the livestock keeper (other than the owner) notice of intended seizure in a form which the Director may specify and obtained a warrant issued by a magistrate under subsection (2) for that purpose. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 11)

A magistrate may issue a warrant to the Director to seize livestock that the Director has reasonable cause to suspect is being kept in contravention of section 15A(1) or 15AA if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for seizing that livestock. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 11)
Where the Director seizes any livestock in accordance with a warrant issued under subsection (2) he shall, if required, produce that warrant.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) of intended seizure of any livestock shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds upon which the Director seeks to rely in reasonably suspecting that that livestock is being kept in contravention of section 15A(1) or 15AA; and (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the Director intends to apply to a magistrate for a warrant to seize that livestock being a date not less than 7 clear days following service of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) of intended seizure of any livestock shall be deemed to have been duly served on the owner of the livestock or the livestock keeper (other than the owner) if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is delivered to him, or to the person whom the Director believes to be the owner or the livestock keeper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is sent by recorded delivery to the livestock premises in or on which the livestock the subject of the intended seizure is kept.

subsection.content: The magistrate shall, before issuing a warrant under subsection (2), give the owner of the livestock or the livestock keeper (other than the owner) if present before him the opportunity of addressing him on the reasonableness or otherwise of the grounds relied upon by the Director under subsection (4)(a).

subsection.leadIn: The Director may authorize in writing any person to keep livestock in or on any premises in a livestock waste restriction area if he is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the premises have been continuously used for livestock keeping for at least 12 months before the commencement of section 2 of the Waste Disposal (Amendment) Ordinance 1994 (28 of 1994); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no ex gratia payment for cessation of livestock keeping in or on the premises has been made by the Government.

subsection.content: Any person may apply to the Director for a grant to him of an authorization under subsection (1).
The Director may require the person making the application to furnish any relevant information and documents of any class or description before deciding whether or not to grant the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, after he has received a written application made under subsection (2) and any relevant information and documents he had required under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant a written authorization to the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a notice on the applicant notifying him that the Director has decided to refuse to grant a written authorization to him.

subsection.content: If the Director is satisfied that a person authorized under subsection (1) is no longer keeping livestock in or on the premises on which he is authorized to keep livestock, he may revoke the written authorization by serving a notice of revocation on that person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a notice under subsection (5) is duly served if it is served personally on the authorized person or his employee, or is sent by registered post to the authorized person’s last known address, or is left with any occupier over the age of 18 years of the relevant premises.

part.name: P3B
part.heading: Notification of Pollution Arising from Livestock Waste

subsection.content: Where in the opinion of the Director pollution to the environment by livestock waste generated or produced in or on livestock premises exists or is imminent, the Director may notify in writing the livestock keeper of the livestock premises of the existence or imminence of such pollution.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, in a notice under subsection (1), direct the livestock keeper to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with any standard or limit contained in any relevant Code of Practice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cease the use of or remove any plant, machinery, vehicle, or equipment which in the opinion of the Director is used in an improper manner or improper for the collection, storage, treatment, transportation or disposal of waste, and to implement any remedial measures as may be specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: restore the proper operation of any plant, machinery, vehicle, equipment or process for the collection, storage, treatment, transportation or disposal of waste, or maintain such plant, machinery, vehicle or equipment, in a proper manner as specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: cease any procedure used for the collection, storage, treatment, transportation or disposal of waste as specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: take such other appropriate measures for the purpose of preventing or mitigating pollution as are specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: within a specified period.

subsection.content: A notice issued under subsection (1) shall specify a reasonable period of time for the livestock keeper to comply with its directions.
The Director may issue any such supplementary notice as may be necessary to vary or add to the directions of a previous notice.

A notice is duly served if it is served personally on the livestock keeper or his employee, or is sent by registered post to the livestock keeper’s last known address, or is left with any occupier over the age of 18 years of the livestock premises.

Any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with the directions of a notice issued under this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 in the case of a first offence and a fine at level 6 in the case of a second or subsequent offence and, in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $10,000 for each day or part of a day on which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Prohibition of unauthorized disposal of waste

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person shall not use, or permit to be used, any land or premises for the disposal of waste unless he has a licence from the Director to use the land or premises for that purpose. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 74 of 1986; 86 of 1991 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to the use of land or premises for— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disposal of household waste from a private dwelling if the disposal takes place within the curtilage of that dwelling;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disposal of waste if the land is used for tipping by the Civil Engineering and Development Department or such use is authorized by the Director; (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 127 of 1986; L.N. 364 of 1991; L.N. 104 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the deposit of any substance (other than chemical waste or clinical waste) which is being used in the course of agricultural or horticultural operations; (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 6; 6 of 2006 s. 6)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disposal of chemical waste or clinical waste by a person who is authorized, pursuant to any regulation made under section 33(1)(da), to use the land or premises for that purpose; (Replaced 6 of 2006 s. 6)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: the disposal of e-waste that is not chemical waste on land or premises with an area of not more than 100 m²; (Added 3 of 2016 s. 13)

paragraph.name: eb
paragraph.content: the storage of e-waste with a total volume of not more than 50 m³ (measured by the maximum width by the maximum height and the maximum length); (Added 3 of 2016 s. 13)

paragraph.name: ec
ed
paragraph.content: the treatment, reprocessing or recycling of container waste on land or premises with a waste disposal facility that is capable of treating, reprocessing or recycling not more than one tonne of container waste per day; (Added 13 of 2016 s. 10)

paragraph.name: ee
paragraph.content: the storage of container waste the total volume of which does not exceed 50 m3 (measured by the maximum width by the maximum height by the maximum length); (Added 13 of 2016 s. 10)

paragraph.name: ef
paragraph.content: the storage of container waste on premises located inside a multi-storey building; (Added 13 of 2016 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the disposal of such wastes or classes of wastes in such circumstances as may be prescribed. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 6)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Despite subsection (2)(ea), (eb) and (ec), a person may apply to the Director for a licence to use any land or premises for the disposal of e-waste. (Added 3 of 2016 s. 13)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment and subject to the approval of the Legislative Council, by notice published in the Gazette, amend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(ea) by varying the area mentioned in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(eb) by varying the total volume mentioned in that subsection. (Added 3 of 2016 s. 13)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.content: Despite subsection (2)(ed), (ee) and (ef), a person may apply to the Director for a licence to use any land or premises for the disposal of container waste. (Added 13 of 2016 s. 10)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment and subject to the approval of the Legislative Council, by notice published in the Gazette, amend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(ed) by varying the weight mentioned in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(ee) by varying the total volume mentioned in that subsection. (Added 13 of 2016 s. 10)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.

Where waste other than chemical waste or clinical waste is disposed of on unleased land, as defined in the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28), pursuant to a licence issued under section 5 of that Ordinance, no licence under subsection (1) shall be required. (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 6; 29 of 1998 s. 68; 6 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s16A
section.heading: Prohibition of unlawful depositing of waste

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if he deposits or causes or permits to be deposited waste in any place except with lawful authority or excuse, or except with the permission of any owner or lawful occupier of the place.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), if waste is deposited from a vehicle that is not being used as a public transport carrier, the following persons are regarded as causing the waste to be deposited—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver of the vehicle at the time when the waste is deposited from it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person employing that driver to drive the vehicle at that time.

subsection.content: A person charged with an offence under subsection (1) has a defence if he proves that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the general nature of subsection (3), a person establishes the defence under that subsection if he proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that he acted under instructions from his employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that he relied on information supplied by another person and had no reason to believe that the information was false or misleading,

subsection.continued: and in either case that he had no reason to believe that an offence would be committed.

subsection.leadIn: If a person wishes to rely on a defence involving an allegation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the commission of the offence was not due to his acting under the instructions of his employer but was due to an act or omission of another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that he relied on information supplied by another person,

subsection.continued: he is not entitled, without leave of the court, to rely on the defence unless he has served on the prosecutor, at least 7 clear days before the hearing, a notice giving all information he then had that identifies or assists in identifying the other person.

subsection.def: For the purpose of subsection (2), public transport carrier (公共交通工具) means a public bus, public light bus, taxi, train, light rail vehicle or tramcar.

section.name: s16B
section.heading: Prohibition of depositing of construction waste on private lot without valid permission

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to the depositing of construction waste on a private lot except when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total area on which construction waste has been deposited within the lot, regardless of who deposited the waste, does not exceed 20 m2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the depositing forms part of any building works carried out on the lot that commenced in accordance with an enactment specified in Schedule 13.

subsection.content: In calculating the total area for subsection (1)(a), waste containing both construction waste and other waste is regarded as consisting entirely of construction waste.

Subject to subsection (5), a person who deposits, or causes to be deposited, construction waste on a private lot without the valid permission of the sole owner or all of the owners of the lot commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (3), the permission is valid only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is given in a form specified by the Director under section 16C(2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form giving the permission bears an acknowledgement affixed by the Director in accordance with section 16C(3).

subsection.content: For a private lot owned by a sole owner, the reference to “a person” in subsection (3) does not include the owner.

Section 16A(2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) applies in relation to an offence under subsection (3) in the same way as it applies in relation to an offence under section 16A(1). For this purpose, the reference to “subsection (1)” in section 16A(2) and (3) is taken to be a reference to subsection (3).

section.name: s16C
section.heading: Specified form for permission for depositing construction waste on private lot and Director’s acknowledgement

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AcknowledgedForm
def.leadIn: acknowledged form (經認收表格), in relation to a depositing activity, means a specified form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which the permission for the depositing activity is given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on which an acknowledgement is affixed in accordance with subsection (3);

subsection.def: depositing activity (擺放活動) means the depositing of construction waste on a private lot;
owners (擁有人), in subsection (3)(b)(i) and (ii), includes a sole owner;
permission (許可), in relation to a depositing activity, means the permission of the sole owner or all of the owners of the lot on which the depositing activity is carried out;
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified under subsection (2)(a).

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a form in which the permission for a depositing activity is to be given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the form any information or document that the Director requires in relation to the permission.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may affix an acknowledgement on a specified form concerning a depositing activity only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form is submitted to the Director, together with the information and documents specified in it, at least 21 days before the intended date on which the depositing activity is to commence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owners identified in the form are the persons who appear from the register kept under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) to be the owners of the lot (owners on record); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the form is signed by or on behalf of all owners on record.

subsection.content: A person who deposits construction waste on a private lot must, at all times during the depositing activity, display in a conspicuous place on the lot a copy of the acknowledged form for the depositing activity.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only requires the display of the part of an acknowledged form which is specified in the form to be for display; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not apply if the depositing activity may be lawfully carried out without the permission given in an acknowledged form.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person submits under subsection (3)(a) a specified form, or any information or document specified in it, which the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knows to be incorrect or inaccurate in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not believe to be correct and accurate in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person fails to comply with subsection (4).

section.name: s17
section.heading: Notice to be given of prescribed wastes

subsection.leadIn: Any person having in his possession waste of a class, quantity or other description as may be prescribed, shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before complying with any requirement imposed by regulations made under section 33(1)(ha); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless such waste has been exempted by regulations made under section 33(1),

subsection.continued: give notice to the Director regarding such waste in such form as may be specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Director may give directions in writing to any person who is required to give notice under subsection (1), regarding the disposal of any waste in respect of which he is required to give such notice.

subsection.leadIn: Directions under subsection (2) may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in addition to;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in substitution for; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in variation of,

subsection.continued: any requirement imposed by regulations made under section 33(1)(ha) and in any particular case those regulations shall apply subject to any directions given in respect of such case.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who fails to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice to the Director as required under this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with any direction given under this section,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Penalties for offences under sections 16, 16A, 16B, 16C and 17 and defences

subsection.leadIn: Any person who commits an offence under section 16, 16A or 16B is liable— (Amended 19 of 2013 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first offence, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $10,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued.

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under section 16C(6) or (7) is liable to a fine at level 6. (Added 19 of 2013 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who commits an offence under section 17 is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first offence, to a fine at level 6; (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $10,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Added 28 of 1994 s. 15)

subsection.content: A person does not commit an offence under section 16, 16A, 16B or 17 if he proves that the waste was disposed of in an emergency to avoid danger to the public and as soon as was reasonably practicable he informed the Director thereof in writing. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 74 of 1986; 19 of 2013 s. 5)
Subsection (4) applies to a person charged with an offence under section 16 for the storage, treatment, reprocessing or recycling of any e-waste that is not chemical waste. (Added 3 of 2016 s. 14)

It is a defence to the charge for the person to establish that the electrical equipment or electronic equipment concerned did not fall within the definition of that equipment in column 3 of Part 1 of Schedule 6 to the Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance (Cap. 603). (Added 3 of 2016 s. 14. Amended 27 of 2023 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established a fact that needs to be established for the defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt. (Added 3 of 2016 s. 14)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Power of magistrate to order removal of waste from Government land or payment of Director’s expenses

subsection.leadIn: If a person is convicted of an offence under section 16A in respect of waste deposited on Government land, the magistrate may, either on application by the Director or on the magistrate’s own initiative, order the person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove the waste from that land within the period specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director has already removed the waste, pay the Director any expenses reasonably incurred by him in carrying out the removal.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (1) is in addition to any penalty imposed under section 18 in respect of an offence under section 16A.

A person who is subject to an order under subsection (1)(a) shall inform the Director immediately upon completion of the removal of the waste concerned by delivering by hand a written notice at his office or sending a written notice by registered post to his office address.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order made against him under subsection (1)(a) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months on the first occasion on which he is convicted of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months on each subsequent occasion on which he is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to an additional daily penalty of $10,000 for each day on which the offence is proved, to the satisfaction of the magistrate, to have continued.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.
For the purposes of this section, a reference to Government land is a reference to unleased land as defined in the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28).

section.name: s19
section.heading: Information as to waste delivered for disposal

subsection.content: The Director may require any person who delivers to him for disposal any waste (other than household waste) to state the nature of the waste and to give such other information relating to the waste as the Director may require. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 74 of 1986)

Any person who, in complying with a requirement under subsection (1) makes any statement or gives any information which he knows to be incorrect in a material particular or who recklessly makes a statement or gives information which is incorrect in a material particular or knowingly omits any material particular therefrom commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 7)

part.name: P4A
part.heading: Control of Movement of Waste Into and Out of Hong Kong

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Permit required for the import of waste into Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: The import into Hong Kong of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any waste of a kind specified in the Sixth Schedule, unless the waste is uncontaminated and is imported for the purpose of a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation or the reuse of the waste; (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any waste of a kind specified in the Seventh Schedule or column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 7A, or not specified in the Sixth Schedule; or (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 15; 13 of 2016 s. 11; 29 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any container waste that does not fall within the description of paragraph (a) or (b), (Added 13 of 2016 s. 11)

subsection.continued: requires a permit issued by the waste disposal authority under this section.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a permit under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be in the form that the waste disposal authority directs specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reason for the proposed waste import;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the importer of the waste;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the waste producer;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the disposer of the waste;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the address of the waste disposal or reuse facility to be used;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the name and address of every intended carrier of the waste or his agent;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the names of the states of export and transit and their competent authorities;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: whether the permit is for a single shipment or multiple shipments;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the projected date of each shipment and the period of time over which waste is to be imported;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the mode of transportation envisaged;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a physical description of the waste and its composition and information on any special handling requirements;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: the type of packaging envisaged;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: the estimated quantity by weight or volume of waste to be imported;

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: details of the process by which and place at which the waste was or is being generated;

subparagraph.name: xv
subparagraph.content: a description of the method of disposal or reuse; and
such other information as the waste disposal authority may reasonably require to determine whether or not to issue a permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: documents confirming the contractual arrangements, if any, for the disposal or reuse of the waste;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a contingency plan showing the procedures to be followed in case of accident;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The waste disposal authority may either issue, with or without conditions, or refuse to issue a permit for the import of the waste, and shall notify the applicant of his decision and, in the case of refusal, the reasons for such refusal.

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority shall not issue a permit under this section for the import of any waste unless he is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the waste will be managed in Hong Kong in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong and in an environmentally sound manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that there is in force, or there will be in force at the time of the import of the waste—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: liability insurance to cover claims arising out of damage to human health, property and the environment which may result from the import operation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a bond, or other financial guarantee acceptable to the waste disposal authority, providing for payment to the waste disposal authority of the cost of any seizure or disposal of the waste under section 20F that may occur; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of waste to be imported other than for the purpose of reuse or a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the state of export does not have the facilities, capacity or disposal sites that would allow disposal of the waste in an environmentally sound manner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the import of the waste is for a purpose which the waste disposal authority considers necessary or desirable in the interests of the environmentally sound and efficient management of the waste disposal system in Hong Kong; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 8)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of waste to be imported for reuse or for a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation, that the waste is required as a raw material for such reuse or operation in Hong Kong; and (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 8)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of waste of a kind specified in the Seventh Schedule, that the waste is not exported from a state or party that is referred to in Schedule 9. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 8)

section.name: s20B
section.heading: Permit required for the export of waste from Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: The export from Hong Kong of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any waste of a kind specified in the Sixth Schedule, unless the waste is uncontaminated and is exported for the purpose of a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation or the reuse of the waste; (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any waste of a kind specified in the Seventh Schedule or column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 7A, or not specified in the Sixth Schedule; or (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 16; 13 of 2016 s. 12; 29 of 2024 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any container waste that does not fall within the description of paragraph (a) or (b), (Added 13 of 2016 s. 12)

subsection.continued: requires a permit issued by the waste disposal authority under this section.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a permit under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be in the form that the waste disposal authority directs specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reason for the proposed waste export;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the exporter of the waste;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the waste producer;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the disposer of the waste;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the address of the waste disposal or reuse facility to be used;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the name and address of every intended carrier of the waste or his agent;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the names of the states of import and transit and their competent authorities;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: whether the permit is for a single shipment or multiple shipments;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the projected date of each shipment and the period of time over which waste is to be exported;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the mode of transportation envisaged;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a physical description of the waste and its composition and information on any special handling requirements;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: the type of packaging envisaged;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: the estimated quantity by weight or volume of waste to be exported;

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: details of the process by which and place at which the waste was or is being generated;

subparagraph.name: xv
subparagraph.content: a description of the method of disposal or reuse; and
such other information as the waste disposal authority may reasonably require to determine whether or not to issue a permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: documents confirming the contractual arrangements, if any, for the disposal or reuse of the waste;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The waste disposal authority may either issue, with or without conditions, or refuse to issue a permit for the export of the waste, and shall notify the applicant of his decision and, in the case of refusal, the reasons for such refusal.

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority shall not issue a permit under this section for the export of any waste unless he is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: that the competent authority of the state of import and of each state of transit has confirmed that its laws, if any, as regards the existence of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: liability insurance to cover claims arising out of damage to human health, property and the environment which may result from the export operation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a bond, or other financial guarantee, providing for payment to the competent authority of the state of import and each state of transit of the cost of any seizure or disposal of the waste by such competent authority,

paragraph.continued: have been complied with in respect of the proposed export;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the waste will be managed or disposed of in an environmentally sound manner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the waste will not be disposed of within the area south of the parallel of 60° south; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 9)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of waste to be exported other than for the purpose of a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation or the reuse of the waste, that—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the export of the waste is for a purpose which the waste disposal authority considers necessary or desirable in the interests of the environmentally sound and efficient management of the waste disposal system in Hong Kong; and (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 9)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in the case of waste to be exported for the purpose of a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation or for reuse, that the waste is required as a raw material for such operation or reuse in the state of import.

section.name: s20C
section.heading: Variation, suspension or revocation of permit

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary, suspend or revoke a permit if it appears to him that there has been a breach of the permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: revoke a suspension of a permit if he is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the permit holder has not breached a permit provision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the permit holder has rectified a breach of a permit provision; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the circumstances that gave rise to the suspension no longer exist.

subsection.content: Every permit suspended or revoked by the waste disposal authority and all copies of such permit in the possession of the permit holder or any other person shall be surrendered immediately to the waste disposal authority by the permit holder.
Any person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s20D
section.heading: Authority may issue directions regarding import and export of waste

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority may from time to time in respect of the import or export of waste for which a permit is required under this Part issue directions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as to the packaging, labelling, handling, transport and disposal of the waste;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring the waste to be accompanied, from the commencement of the consignment to the point of disposal, by a movement document containing such information or particulars as the waste disposal authority may require;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: requiring an applicant for a permit for the export of any waste to take back the waste when the consignment cannot be completed; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: requiring an applicant for a permit for the import of any waste to ensure that the disposer of the waste notifies in writing the exporter and the competent authority of the state of export of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: receipt by the disposer of the waste at the point of disposal or reuse of the waste; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the completion of disposal or reuse of the waste as proposed in the application for the permit,

paragraph.continued: and to do so within a period specified in the direction.

subsection.content: A direction issued under this section shall for the purposes of this Part be deemed to form part of and be a condition of every permit issued under this Part subsequent to the coming into effect of the direction.

section.name: s20DA
section.heading: Authorization for disposal of certain imported waste

subsection.def: This section applies only to waste the import of which into Hong Kong does not require a permit under section 20A, and the reference to imported waste (進口廢物) in this section shall be construed as a reference to waste of this category that has been imported into Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The disposal of any imported waste at a designated waste disposal facility requires an authorization granted by the waste disposal authority under this section.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the authorization shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in writing in such form as the waste disposal authority may specify; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such application fee as may be prescribed by regulations made under section 33.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of an application made by any person (the applicant) for the authorization, the waste disposal authority may, subject to subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant the authorization, with or without conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to grant the authorization,

subsection.continued: and shall notify the applicant of his decision and, in the case of refusal, the reasons for such refusal.

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority shall not grant an authorization under subsection (4)(a) unless the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the import of the waste concerned into Hong Kong did not require a permit under section 20A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not practicable to make alternative arrangement for the imported waste to be used (whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere) for the purpose of reuse, or a reprocessing, recycling or recovery operation (the specified purpose), in a manner acceptable to the authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is not practicable for the applicant to return, or cause the importer of the imported waste to return, the imported waste to the state of export,

subsection.continued: and in determining the practicability of the matters specified in paragraphs (b) and (c), the lack of financial means to carry out an alternative arrangement or return the imported waste to the state of export (as the case may be) shall not be a relevant consideration.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (4)(a), a condition attached to an authorization may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to pay such charge as the waste disposal authority may determine for recovery of the cost of disposal of the imported waste;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the manner, place and time of the disposal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the arrangements to be made and the procedures to be observed in relation to the disposal.

subsection.leadIn: The waste disposal authority may require an applicant to furnish him with such information as he considers necessary for determining whether or not to grant the authorization, and in particular, such information may relate to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the details of the original arrangement made for the imported waste to be used for the specified purpose after the import;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the original arrangement cannot be carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: proof of any attempt made in making alternative arrangement for the imported waste—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be used (whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere) for the specified purpose;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to be returned to the state of export.

subsection.content: The provisions in this section shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from any other provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a permit issued or an authorization granted under this Part, does anything for which such a permit or authorization is required; or (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a permit issued or an authorization granted under this Part, causes or allows another person to do anything for which such a permit or authorization is required, (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 11)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: for the first offence to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, to procure the issue of a permit or the grant of an authorization under this Part— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement which he knows to be false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly makes a statement which is false in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s20F
section.heading: Seizure and disposal of waste following conviction

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is convicted of an offence under section 20E in respect of the import or export of any waste, or the disposal of any imported waste referred to in section 20DA(2), the waste disposal authority may— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seize and dispose of the waste; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing require the convicted person, within a specified time—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a conviction in respect of the import of waste or the disposal of any imported waste referred to in section 20DA(2), to return the waste to the state of export, or to dispose of the waste in Hong Kong to the satisfaction of the waste disposal authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a conviction in respect of the export of waste, to take back the waste into Hong Kong, or, if that is not reasonably practicable, to dispose of the waste in an environmentally sound manner,

paragraph.continued: and may, by such notice or by any other notice in writing, require the convicted person to furnish the waste disposal authority within a specified time with documentary evidence to show that the requirements made under subparagraph (i) or (ii) have been complied with.

subsection.content: If any person fails to comply with a notice given under subsection (1)(b) he commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and where a person is convicted of an offence under this subsection the waste disposal authority may, without further notice, seize and dispose of the waste.

subsection.leadIn: Where the waste disposal authority seizes or disposes of any waste under subsection (1)(a) or (2)— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the offence is in respect of the import or export of any waste) the importer or exporter of the waste, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the offence is in respect of the disposal of any imported waste referred to in section 20DA(2)) the convicted person,

subsection.continued: shall be liable to the waste disposal authority for the cost of such seizure and disposal, including the cost of any transportation and storage, and such cost shall be recoverable as a civil debt due to the waste disposal authority.

subsection.content: A person charged with an offence under this Part has a defence if he proves that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the general nature of subsection (1), a person establishes the defence under that subsection if he proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he acted under instructions from his employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he relied on information supplied by another person without reason to believe that the information was false or misleading,
