subsection.continued: and in either case that he took all steps reasonably open to him to ensure that an offence would not be committed. (Amended L.N. 29 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: If a person wishes to rely on a defence involving an allegation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that he relied on information supplied by another person,

subsection.continued: he is not entitled, without leave of the court, to rely on the defence unless 7 clear days before the hearing, he has served on the prosecutor a notice giving all information he then had that identifies or assists in identifying the other person.

section.name: s20H
section.heading: Amendment of Sixth Schedule, Seventh Schedule and Schedule 7A
section.content: The waste disposal authority may by notice published in the Gazette amend the Sixth Schedule, the Seventh Schedule or Schedule 7A.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: competent authority (主管當局) means such authority as may be designated by the government of a sovereign state to be responsible, within such geographical areas as that government deems, for receiving the notification of transboundary movement of waste, and any such information related to such movement, and for responding to such notification;

disposal (處置), in relation to waste, means any transfer operation, storage, reprocessing, recycling, material recovery, deposit, destruction, discharge (whether into water or into a sewer or drain or otherwise) or burial (whether underground or otherwise), and dispose of shall be construed accordingly;

disposer (處置者), in relation to waste imported into Hong Kong, means the person who carries out the disposal of the waste, or reuses the waste, in the manner contemplated in the application for a permit for the import of the waste;

def.name: ExportFromHongKong
def.leadIn: export from Hong Kong (輸出香港), in relation to waste, means to take, or cause to be taken, out of Hong Kong any waste, but does not include a reference to waste which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was brought into Hong Kong solely for the purpose of taking it out of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remained at all times in or on the vessel, aircraft, train or vehicle in or on which it was brought into Hong Kong;

subsection.def: import into Hong Kong (輸入香港), in relation to waste, means to bring, or cause to be brought, into Hong Kong any waste for the purpose of disposal or reuse in Hong Kong or for the purpose of loading prior to disposal or reuse in an area not under the jurisdiction of any state;
state of export (輸出國), in relation to the import of waste into Hong Kong, means a state, territory or geographical area from which such import is planned to be initiated or is initiated;

state of import (輸入國), in relation to the export of waste from Hong Kong, means a state, territory or geographical area to which such export is planned to take place for the purpose of disposal or reuse in that state, territory or geographical area or for the purpose of loading prior to disposal or reuse in an area not under the jurisdiction of any state;

state of transit (過境國) means any state, territory or geographical area, other than Hong Kong or the state of export or the state of import, through which a transboundary movement of waste is planned or takes place;

transboundary movement (越境移運) means any movement of waste from an area under the jurisdiction of one state or territory to or through an area under the jurisdiction of another state or territory, or to or through an area not under the jurisdiction of any state, where at least 2 such states or territories are involved in the movement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, waste is contaminated if it is contaminated by a substance to an extent which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: significantly increases the risk to human health, property or the environment associated with the waste; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.text: prevents the reprocessing, recycling, recovery or reuse of the waste in an environmentally sound manner,

subsection.continued: and uncontaminated (未受污染) in relation to waste shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, waste is managed or disposed of in an environmentally sound manner if it is managed or disposed of in a manner which will, as far as is practicable, protect human health and the environment against any adverse effects which may result from such waste.

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to waste that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: derived from the normal operations of a vessel, aircraft, train or vehicle or its equipment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: brought into or taken out of Hong Kong in or on the vessel, aircraft, train or vehicle.

subsection.content: The purpose of this Part is to establish a quantity-based charging scheme for the disposal of municipal solid waste to achieve waste reduction.
Division 2 provides for the mandatory use of designated bags or designated labels when disposing of municipal solid waste.
Division 3 regulates the production, sale and supply of designated bags and designated labels.
Division 4 contains miscellaneous provisions.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Mandatory Use of Designated Bags or Designated Labels

section.name: s20Q
section.heading: Exemption from section 20K, 20L or 20M granted on application

subsection.leadIn: If satisfied that it is reasonable to do so, the Director may, on application by a person (applicant), exempt any person from section 20K(1), 20L(1) or 20M(1) in relation to any deposit or delivery of municipal solid waste that is collected—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for or on behalf of the Government; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the course of providing service for collecting material that is reasonably suitable for recycling.

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1) must be made in the form specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must, by written notice, inform the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director’s decision to grant, or refuse to grant, the exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director refuses to grant the exemption—the reason for the refusal.

subsection.content: An exemption granted under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.
An exemption granted under subsection (1) is valid for a period specified by the Director and may be renewed by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke an exemption granted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the application for the exemption, the applicant provided any information that was false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition specified under subsection (4) for the exemption is contravened; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that there is no longer any justification for the exemption.

subsection.content: If an exemption is revoked under subsection (6), the Director must, by written notice, inform the applicant of the revocation and the reason for it.

section.name: s20R
section.heading: Exemption from section 20K, 20L or 20M granted on Director’s own initiative

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director may, on the Director’s own initiative, exempt any person or class of persons (exempted person) from section 20K(1), 20L(1) or 20M(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not grant an exemption under subsection (1) unless the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exemption is necessary for public safety, environmental hygiene or environmental protection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: due to exceptional circumstances—

subparagraph.content: it is unreasonable to expect such compliance.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must inform the exempted person of the Director’s decision to grant the exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a written notice is impracticable in the circumstances—in a way that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.content: An exemption granted under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.
An exemption granted under subsection (1) is valid for a period specified by the Director and may be renewed by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke an exemption granted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any condition specified under subsection (4) for the exemption is contravened; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that there is no longer any justification for the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: If an exemption is revoked under subsection (6), the Director must inform the exempted person of the revocation and the reason for it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a written notice is impracticable in the circumstances—in a way that the Director considers appropriate.

section.name: s20S
section.heading: Who may produce, sell or supply for free

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce designated bags or designated labels;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sell designated bags or designated labels; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: supply designated bags or designated labels for free.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on the terms and conditions specified by the Director, authorize any person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce designated bags or designated labels;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sell designated bags or designated labels; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: supply, in the course of a profit-seeking business, designated bags or designated labels for free.

subsection.content: The Director may revoke an authorization granted under subsection (2) if any term or condition specified for the authorization is contravened.

section.name: s20T
section.heading: Director may specify requirements
section.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify requirements for designated bags and designated labels, including their sizes, shapes, designs and materials.

subsection.content: A person who is not authorized under section 20S(2)(b) commits an offence if the person sells, offers to sell or exhibits for the purpose of sale any designated bag or designated label.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (1) does not apply if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of business, provides or arranges for the provision of a waste collection service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sells, offers to sell or exhibits for the purpose of sale to a user of the service the designated bag or designated label at the price prescribed for the bag or label in Schedule 14.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction—to a fine at level 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine of $200,000.

section.name: s20V
section.heading: Sale at other than prescribed price prohibited

subsection.content: A person who is authorized under section 20S(2)(b) commits an offence if the person sells, offers to sell or exhibits for the purpose of sale any designated bag or designated label at a price other than the price prescribed for the bag or label in Schedule 14.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is authorized under section 20S(2)(b) commits an offence if the person offers to a customer any rebate or discount that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the effect of directly or indirectly offsetting the price, or any part of the price, of a designated bag or designated label; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not generally applicable to other goods offered for sale by the person.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person purchases any designated bag or designated label from a seller;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: because of the purchase, the person receives a favour (whether or not transferable) that in effect reduces the price of an item (whether or not a designated bag or designated label) in a subsequent purchase from the seller; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the favour is offered under an arrangement that is generally applicable to the purchase of goods (whether or not a designated bag or designated label) from the seller,

subsection.continued: the favour is not a rebate or discount that falls within subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction—to a fine at level 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person supplies, in the course of a profit-seeking business, any designated bag or designated label for free.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (1) does not apply if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is authorized under section 20S(2)(c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides or arranges for the provision of a waste collection service and supplies the designated bag or designated label for use in relation to the service.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction—to a fine at level 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.leadIn: The Director of FEH may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sign to be exhibited at refuse collection points and the way of exhibition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sign to be exhibited on waste vehicles in Government service and the way of exhibition; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the sign to be exhibited on specified bins and the way of exhibition.

subsection.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe the sign to be exhibited on waste vehicles in private use (with compactor) and the way of exhibition.

section.name: s20ZA
section.heading: Designated bag not subject to Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance
section.content: To avoid doubt, a designated bag is not a plastic shopping bag to which the Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance (Cap. 603) applies.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Applications for and grant of licences

subsection.content: A person who wishes to apply for a waste collection licence shall apply to the collection authority in such form as the collection authority may specify. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 13)
A person who wishes to apply for a waste disposal licence shall apply to the waste disposal authority in such form as the waste disposal authority may specify. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 13)
An application under subsection (1) or (2) shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee. (Amended 8 of 1986 s. 8; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
Subject to section 21A, the appropriate licensing authority may either grant or refuse to grant a licence. (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 8)
If he refuses to grant a licence, the licensing authority shall within 30 days of such refusal notify the applicant in writing of his refusal and shall inform him of his reasons therefor.

subsection.leadIn: The licensing authority shall not grant a licence under this section where he considers that, notwithstanding any authorization or requirement conferred or imposed pursuant to section 22—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the waste collection or disposal operation will not be able to achieve all the limits, and requirements, and quality standards and quality objectives prescribed in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Air Pollution Control Ordinance (Cap. 311);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Water Pollution Control Ordinance (Cap. 358); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Noise Control Ordinance (Cap. 400); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any emission or discharge arising from the waste collection or disposal operation would be or would be likely to be a danger to public health, a source of pollution to the environment or a source of nuisance to the neighbouring area. (Added 14 of 1995 s. 4)

subsection.content: The waste disposal authority is not required to consider an application under subsection (2) unless it is made by the owner or lawful occupier of the land or premises used for the conduct of the waste disposal operation in question. (Added 14 of 1995 s. 4. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in or in connection with an application under this section, makes any statement (whether such statement be oral or written), or furnishes any information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which he knows or reasonably ought to know is false or misleading in such particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence, and is liable to a fine at level 6. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 13)

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Circumstances under which waste disposal licence for chemical waste, clinical waste, e-waste or container waste is to be granted
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 21(4), if a person applies for a waste disposal licence in respect of any land or premises, the licensing authority must not grant the licence in respect of chemical waste, clinical waste, e-waste or container waste under that section unless the licensing authority is satisfied that the land or premises has a waste disposal facility that— (Amended 13 of 2016 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the capacity to dispose of such minimum quantity of chemical waste, clinical waste, e-waste or container waste (as the case requires) and within such period as may be prescribed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is capable of disposing of chemical waste, clinical waste, e-waste or container waste (as the case requires) in such other manner as may be prescribed.

subsection.leadIn: A waste collection licence shall, subject to the terms and conditions thereof and during the period specified therein, authorize and require all or any of the following— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the removal and disposal of household waste, street waste, trade waste, livestock waste or animal waste; (Amended 58 of 1987 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cleansing and emptying of pail latrines;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the desludging of aqua privies and septic tanks;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the removal and disposal of excretal matter from such latrines, privies and tanks;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the collection or removal of chemical waste or clinical waste (as the case may be). (Added 86 of 1991 s. 10)

subsection.content: A waste disposal licence shall, subject to the terms and conditions thereof and during the period specified therein, authorize the use of land or premises for the disposal of waste.
A licence issued under this Ordinance shall be for such period and may be subject to such terms and conditions as the authority issuing the same thinks fit.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Without limiting the general nature of the terms and conditions which the authority may include in a waste collection licence, he may include terms and conditions relating to the matters set out in Schedule 10. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 16)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Without limiting the general nature of the terms and conditions which the authority may include in a waste disposal licence, he may include terms and conditions relating to the matters set out in Schedule 11. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 16)
Any licence issued under this Ordinance may, upon its expiry, be renewed upon application and upon payment of the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licence issued under this Ordinance is in force and the authority by whom it was issued considers it necessary in the public interest, the authority may, by notice in writing, to the holder of the licence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: impose new or amended terms or conditions subject to the observance of which, as from a specified date, the licence shall continue in force;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cancel the licence as from a specified date if the holder fails to observe any such term or condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel the licence as from a specified date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: revoke or amend or add to any notice previously given under this subsection, or any part of such notice.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), the date specified in a notice for the addition or amendment of any term or condition under paragraph (a)(i) or (c) of subsection (3) or the cancellation of a licence under paragraph (b) thereof shall be not less than 90 days after the day on which the notice is given to the holder of the licence.

Where in the opinion of the authority by whom a licence is issued it is necessary to amend or add a term or condition under paragraph (a)(i) or (c) of subsection (3) or cancel a licence under paragraph (b) thereof because the continuation of the activities to which the licence relates would cause a danger to public health or would be so seriously detrimental to the amenities of the area affected by the activities that the continuation of them ought not to be permitted, he may exercise any of the said powers with effect from such date as the circumstances may require and shall not be bound to comply with subsection (4). (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 16)

Where a notice is given under subsection (3), the person to whom the notice is given may, within the period of 30 days after such notice is given, make written submissions to the authority by whom the notice was issued as to why any new or amended terms and conditions should not be imposed or as to why the licence should not be cancelled. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 16)

The authority by whom a notice under subsection (3) is issued and to whom written submissions are made by any person under subsection (6) may, after considering such submissions, by further notice to the said person withdraw the notice at any time before it comes into effect. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: If any person who has been granted a waste collection licence or waste disposal licence (as the case may be) contravenes any term or condition subject to which the licence was granted to him, he commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a waste collection licence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first offence, to a fine at level 6; (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of $200,000; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $5,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a waste disposal licence—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in addition, if the offence is a continuing offence to a fine of $10,000 for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued. (Added 28 of 1994 s. 16)

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Authorized officers
section.leadIn: Any public officer may be authorized in writing by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the collection authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the waste disposal authority,

section.continued: to perform or exercise all or any of the functions, duties or powers which are imposed or conferred by this Ordinance upon the Director, the collection authority or the waste disposal authority, as the case may be, by which the public officer is so authorized, or which by virtue of this Ordinance may be exercised by an authorized officer.

section.name: s23B
section.heading: Power of authority to obtain information

subsection.leadIn: By notice in writing served on any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the collection authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the waste disposal authority,

subsection.continued: may require that person to furnish to the authority so requiring, within such time and in such form as is specified in the notice, any information specified in the notice which that authority may reasonably require for the purpose of exercising and performing its functions, duties and powers under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails without reasonable excuse to comply with any of the requirements of a notice served on him under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with such a notice, makes any statement to the authority which he knows to be incorrect in a material respect or recklessly makes any statement to the authority which is incorrect in a material respect or knowingly omits any material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6. (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 17; E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s23C
section.heading: Powers of authorized officers to enter premises, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized officer may, for the purposes of this Ordinance, without a warrant enter any place or premises, stop any vehicle, or stop and board any vessel if he has reason to suspect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the place, premises, vehicle or vessel is being used for, or in connection with, the production, collection, storage, treatment, transportation or disposal of any waste; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is in the place, premises, vehicle or vessel any thing likely to be, or to contain, evidence of an offence against this Ordinance.

subsection.content: An authorized officer shall not under subsection (1) enter any domestic premises (other than that part of such premises in or on which there is a waste treatment plant or facilities for the storage of any waste) or board any vessel used wholly or principally for dwelling purposes unless he has first obtained a warrant issued by a magistrate under subsection (3) for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant to any authorized officer to enter domestic premises or to board any vessel used wholly or principally for dwelling purposes if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence against this Ordinance is being or has been committed in or on those premises or on that vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is in or on those premises or on that vessel any thing likely to be, or to contain, evidence of an offence against this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who enters any place or premises, stops any vehicle or boards any vessel shall, if required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce evidence of his identity and of his authorization under section 23A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a warrant is under this section required for entry, produce that warrant.

section.name: s23D
section.heading: Other powers of authorized officers
section.leadIn: An authorized officer who has, pursuant to section 23C or any warrant issued thereunder, entered any place or premises, stopped any vehicle or boarded any vessel, or who has been allowed access to any place, premises, vehicle or vessel in the course of his duties, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect therein any waste treatment plant or other plant or equipment or observe any process or procedure which he has reason to suspect is being, has been, or is intended to be, used in connection with the collection, storage, treatment, transportation or disposal of any waste;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the person who appears to him to be in charge of the place, premises, vehicle or vessel to do anything which the authorized officer reasonably considers to be necessary for facilitating an inspection or observation under paragraph (a); (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 18)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the person who appears to him to be in charge of the place, premises, vehicle or vessel to produce for examination any drawing, record or document which is in the possession of such person, or which such person can reasonably obtain, relating to any waste treatment plant or other plant or equipment inspected under paragraph (a); (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 18)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: seize, remove and detain any such drawing, record or document produced under paragraph (c) or any other article or thing found therein if he has reason to suspect that it is, or contains, evidence of an offence against this Ordinance; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 17)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: examine and make copies of any records kept pursuant to any requirement under this Ordinance or of any licence or permit issued or any authorization granted under this Ordinance; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 17)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: obtain samples of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any waste or any constituent of waste or of any matter contaminated thereby; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any waste which he has reason to believe may be subject to disposal under section 17; (Amended 28 of 1994 s. 18)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: carry out any necessary tests or take any photographs for the purposes of obtaining evidence in connection with any offence against this Ordinance; (Added 28 of 1994 s. 18. Amended 19 of 2013 s. 6)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: require any person whom he reasonably suspects of having committed an offence against this Ordinance or of having contravened any regulation made under section 33 to state his name and address and to produce documentary evidence showing the name and address, including an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177), for inspection by the authorized officer; and (Added 28 of 1994 s. 18. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 17; 19 of 2013 s. 6)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: require any person whom the officer reasonably suspects of having deposited construction waste on a private lot to produce the original or a copy of the acknowledged form within the meaning of section 16C for the depositing activity for inspection by the officer. (Added 19 of 2013 s. 6)

subsection.content: A certificate of analysis of a sample of any waste or other matter obtained from any place, premises, vehicle or vessel under section 23D(f) may be tendered in evidence in any proceedings under this Ordinance and shall, until the contrary is proved, be evidence of the facts stated therein if the procedure in this section has been complied with, or substantially complied with so far as is reasonably practicable, in relation to that sample.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who obtains a sample of any waste or other matter under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: place the sample in a container and suitably mark or label the container;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: ensure that the person in charge of the place, premises, vehicle or vessel from which the sample is obtained or his employee or agent—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is informed that the sample is intended to be submitted to the analyst for analysis; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: personally submit the sample to the analyst for analysis. (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 18)

subsection.content: As soon as the analyst has completed an analysis under subsection (2)(d) he shall furnish to the collection authority or the waste disposal authority, as the case may be, and to the person in charge of the place, premises, vehicle or vessel from which the sample was obtained or his employee or agent, a certificate of the results of the analysis.

A certificate under subsection (3) shall be signed by the analyst but the analysis may be made by a person acting under the directions of the analyst and any certificate purporting to be signed by the analyst shall be presumed, until the contrary is proved, to have been signed by him.
The Chief Executive may, by notice published in the Gazette, appoint any person to be an analyst for the purposes of this section. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

section.name: s23EA
section.heading: Director’s power to remove waste in case of imminent risk of adverse environmental impact

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under section 16A or 16B has been committed in a place; (Amended 19 of 2013 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the waste deposited in the place is likely to give rise to an imminent risk of adverse environmental impact; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: action needs to be taken immediately to reduce or eliminate that risk,

subsection.continued: then the Director may enter the place to remove the waste.

subsection.content: If a person is convicted of an offence under section 16A or 16B in respect of waste that has been removed by the Director under subsection (1), the magistrate may, on application by the Director, order the person to pay the Director any expenses reasonably incurred by him in carrying out the removal. (Amended 19 of 2013 s. 7)
The Director shall not under subsection (1) enter any domestic premises unless he has first obtained a warrant issued by a magistrate under subsection (4) for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, for the purpose of subsection (1), issue a warrant to the Director to enter any domestic premises if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under section 16A or 16B has been committed in those premises, or in a place that is accessible only through those premises; (Amended 19 of 2013 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the waste deposited in those premises or in that place is likely to give rise to an imminent risk of adverse environmental impact; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: action needs to be taken immediately to reduce or eliminate that risk.

subsection.content: Where the Director enters any domestic premises in accordance with a warrant issued under subsection (4), he shall, if required, produce that warrant.
For the purposes of this section, a reference to domestic premises includes a reference to a dwelling place on any private land.

section.name: s23F
section.heading: Offences in relation to enforcement powers

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: wilfully obstructs—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a collection authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a waste disposal authority; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any authorized officer,

paragraph.continued: in the exercise of the authority’s or the officer’s powers or duties under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: fails without reasonable excuse to comply with any requirement duly made under this Part by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a collection authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a waste disposal authority; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any authorized officer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with any such requirement produces any drawing, document or record which he knows to be incorrect or inaccurate in a material particular or does not believe to be correct and accurate,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is aggrieved by a decision or direction of a public officer or a collection authority or waste disposal authority or the Director under any of the following provisions may appeal to the Appeal Board established under section 25— (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 11)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: section 15F (refusing to grant or revocation of written authorization); (Added 28 of 1994 s. 20)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: section 15G (directions as to livestock waste pollution); (Added 28 of 1994 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 17(1) (directions as to disposal of waste);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 20A(3) and 20B(3) (refusing to issue a permit for the import of waste into or the export of waste from Hong Kong or fixing the conditions of such a permit (including any condition deemed to apply by virtue of section 20D)); (Replaced 14 of 1995 s. 5)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: section 20C(1)(a) (varying, suspending or revoking a permit); (Added 14 of 1995 s. 5)

content.ref: section 20C(1)(b) (revoking the suspension of a permit);

paragraph.name: bc
paragraph.content: section 20DA(4)(a) (fixing the conditions of an authorization for disposal of imported waste); (Added 6 of 2006 s. 19)

paragraph.name: bd
paragraph.content: section 20DA(4)(b) (refusing to grant an authorization for disposal of imported waste); (Added 6 of 2006 s. 19)

paragraph.name: be
paragraph.content: section 20S(2) and (3) (refusing to grant, or revoking, an authorization to produce, sell or supply for free designated bags or designated labels); (Added 25 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sections 21(4) and 21A (refusing to grant a licence); (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 23(1) (fixing terms and conditions of licence);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 23(3)(a)(i) (imposing new or amended terms or conditions for continuance of licence);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: sections 23(3)(a)(ii) and 23(3)(b) (cancelling a licence);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 23(3)(c) (revoking, amending or adding to a notice). (Amended 86 of 1991 s. 11; 17 of 2004 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1B), a person who is aggrieved by a decision or direction of the Director made pursuant to regulations made under section 33 may also appeal to the Appeal Board established under section 25. (Added 17 of 2004 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: No appeal lies under subsection (1A) from any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director’s decision whether or not to accept any waste at a designated waste disposal facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director’s decision whether or not a charge is to be imposed in respect of any waste or class of waste accepted for disposal at a waste disposal facility as may be prescribed by regulations made under section 33. (Added 17 of 2004 s. 6)

subsection.content: An appeal under subsection (1) or (1A) shall be made within 21 days after the person aggrieved has received notice of the decision or direction. (Amended 17 of 2004 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Where the decision appealed from was made under a provision mentioned in subsection (1)(e), (f) or (g) the notice thereof shall be suspended from the day on which notice of appeal is given and until the appeal is disposed of, withdrawn or abandoned, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision is considered by the authority whose decision it is to be necessary because in relation to a licence to which the notice relates the continuation of the activities to which the notice relates would cause a danger to public health or be seriously detrimental to the amenities of the area affected by the activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice contains a statement to that effect.

subsection.leadIn: No appeal may be made under subsection (1)(ab) except on the following grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the service of the notice is not justified by the terms of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that there has been some material informality, defect or error in the form or content of the notice or in connection with the service of the notice; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the notice should have been served on some person other than the appellant. (Added 28 of 1994 s. 20)

subsection.content: Every appeal under section 24 shall be determined by an Appeal Board constituted under this Part.
The Chief Executive shall appoint as Chairman of Appeal Boards a person who is qualified in law. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)
Subject to section 27(3), the Chairman shall be appointed for a term of not more than 3 years but may be reappointed. (Amended 14 of 1995 s. 6)
The Chief Executive shall also appoint a panel of persons whom he considers to be suitable for appointment as members of an Appeal Board pursuant to section 26(1). (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: A member of the panel shall be appointed for a term of not more than 3 years but may be reappointed. (Added 14 of 1995 s. 6)
An appointment under subsection (2) and every appointment to the panel under subsection (4) shall be notified in the Gazette.

subsection.def: In subsection (2) and in section 27(1) qualified in law (具法律專業資格) means qualified for appointment as a District Judge under section 5 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

subsection.content: The jurisdiction of an Appeal Board on any appeal or group of appeals shall be exercised by the Chairman and such number of persons from the panel referred to in section 25(4) as the Chairman may appoint for that appeal or group of appeals.
On any appeal an Appeal Board may confirm, reverse or vary the decision or direction appealed from.

Every question before an Appeal Board shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the Chairman and the members hearing the appeal except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman; in the event of an equality of votes the Chairman shall have a casting vote.
An Appeal Board shall not at any time consist of a majority of persons who are public officers.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: admit or take into account any statement, document, information or matter whether or not it would be admissible as evidence in a court of law; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing summon any person to appear before it to produce any document or to give evidence.

subsection.content: The Chairman may determine any form or matter of practice or procedure in so far as no provision is made therefor in this Ordinance.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Supplementary provisions as to Appeal Board

subsection.content: If the Chairman is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions the Chief Executive may appoint any other person qualified in law to act as Chairman and as such to exercise and perform all of the powers, functions and duties of the Chairman during the period of his appointment. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

If a person appointed by the Chairman under section 26(1) to hear an appeal or group of appeals is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong, or any other cause from exercising his functions, the Chairman may appoint any other person from the panel provided for in section 25(4) to act in his place.
The Chairman may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

content.leadIn: The hearing of an appeal may be continued notwithstanding any change in the membership of an Appeal Board as if the change had not occurred:
content.proviso: Provided that no person shall be appointed as a member of an Appeal Board before which the hearing of an appeal has been commenced without the consent of the parties.

subsection.content: The Chairman may of his own motion, before an appeal is determined, refer any question of law to the Court of Appeal by way of case stated.
On the hearing of the case the Court of Appeal may amend the case or order it to be sent back to the Appeal Board for amendment.

The Chief Executive may give such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the exercise or performance by any public officer of any powers, functions or duties under this Ordinance.
A public officer shall, in the discharge of his powers, functions and duties under this Ordinance, comply with any directions given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Mental ingredients of certain offences under the Ordinance
section.content: In any proceedings for an offence under section 11, 15, 15A, 15AA, 16, 16A, 16B, 16C(7), 17, 18A, 20E or 23 it shall not be necessary for the prosecution to prove that the acts or omissions in question were accompanied by any intention, knowledge or negligence on the part of the defendant as to any element of the offence.

subsection.content: No liability shall rest on the Government or upon any public officer by reason of the fact that any waste collection or waste disposal licence is issued under this Ordinance. (Amended 8 of 1986 s. 8)

A public officer shall not be personally liable in respect of any act or omission of his if it was done or made by him in the honest belief that it was required or authorized in exercise of any power, function or duty of his under this Ordinance.

The protection conferred on public officers by subsection (2) in respect of any act or omission shall not in any way affect any liability of the Government for that act or omission. (Amended 8 of 1986 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment by regulation provide for— (Amended L.N. 165 of 1984; 8 of 1986 s. 8; L.N. 57 of 1994; 78 of 1999 s. 7; 21 of 2024 s. 78)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the additional wastes or classes of waste to which a draft waste disposal plan under section 3 shall apply;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the design and construction of containers or enclosures for the storage of animal waste;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the capacity, design, type, number, construction and materials used in the construction of containers provided in or on livestock premises for the storage of livestock waste; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 11)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: the capacity, design, type, number, construction and materials used in the construction of containers provided outside livestock premises for the collection of livestock waste; (Added 58 of 1987 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the precautions to be taken to guard against dangers to public health or risks of pollution arising from waste;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: the authorization of any person to provide services for the collection or removal of chemical waste or clinical waste without a licence for that purpose; (Added 6 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the waste or classes of waste that may be disposed of under section 16 without a licence;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: the authorization of any person to use any land or premises for the disposal of chemical waste or clinical waste without a licence for that purpose; (Added 6 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any substance, matter or thing to be defined as chemical waste with reference to such substance or chemical as may be prescribed and exceptions thereto, including the exception of any substance, matter or thing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of a class or description specified by the Director by notice in the Gazette; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which the Director is satisfied having regard to such criteria or procedures as may be prescribed, does not constitute a danger to health or risk of pollution to the environment; (Replaced 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: eaa
ea
paragraph.content: the class, quantity or other description of waste in respect of which notice is to be given under section 17; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: eb
paragraph.content: exemptions or exclusions from the requirement to give notice under section 17 or from the regulations or any requirement of the regulations; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: ec
paragraph.content: the registration of persons producing or causing to be produced any waste, the keeping of a register or registers by the Director for that purpose and the particulars to be entered in any such register or registers; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ed
ee
paragraph.content: the inspection of the register in such places and at such times as may be determined by the Director and the issue by him of certified copies of entries in the register; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ef
paragraph.content: the amendment of the register by the Director and the assignment, amendment or cancellation by him of registration numbers; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: eg
paragraph.content: prohibitions against producing or causing to be produced any waste by an unregistered person and the invalidity of the transfer of any registration; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: f

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: prohibiting the distribution of containers or any class of container which do or does not comply with such requirements as may be prescribed under paragraph (f), and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, such prohibition may be by reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the type of container;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of distribution;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: place of distribution by retail sale;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the type of beverage or fluid;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the source of the container;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the storage of any waste, the places, manner and conditions in which it is to be stored including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: requirements as to containers for storage;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the labelling of such containers;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: specifications of and particulars to be contained in such labels;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the display of notices in places of storage;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: specifications of and particulars to be contained in such notices; and

subparagraph.name: vi

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: the collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception, import or export or disposal, including treatment, reprocessing and recycling of any waste including in particular the equipment to be used, the arrangements to be made and the procedure to be observed in relation to such activities; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12. Amended 6 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: haa
paragraph.leadIn: (without limiting the generality of paragraph (ha)) in relation to clinical waste—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the restriction on the class or classes of persons who may deliver or transport clinical waste in prescribed circumstances;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the type and the quantity of clinical waste that may be so delivered or transported;

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: hb
paragraph.content: the duties of any person producing, causing to be produced, or in possession of any waste or engaged in or connected with any activity described in paragraph (ha); (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any fees and charges payable under this Ordinance; (Amended 8 of 1986 s. 8; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the charges payable to the Director for any service provided by or on behalf of the Government in relation to the collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception or disposal (including treatment, reprocessing or recycling) of any waste or class of waste; (Replaced 14 of 1995 s. 8. Amended 21 of 2024 s. 78)

paragraph.name: jaa
paragraph.content: the imposition of charges for the disposal of any waste, which charges may be set at above cost recovery level; (Added 25 of 2021 s. 7)

paragraph.name: ja
paragraph.content: the procedure for appeals under Part VI and the forms to be used in relation to such appeals; (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

paragraph.name: jb

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: generally carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance. (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: empower the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to issue any document, in such form as he may determine, to be used in relation to the production, possession, collection, transportation, transfer, reception, import or export or disposal including treatment, reprocessing or recycling of any waste;

subparagraph.name: ii

subparagraph.name: v

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: storage of waste in excess of a prescribed maximum quantity;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: to grant exemptions with or without conditions from the regulations or any specified provision of the regulations; (Amended 6 of 2006 s. 20)

subparagraph.name: viii
ix
subparagraph.leadIn: to authorize (with or without conditions) any person of a class specified in a regulation made under subsection (1)(ca)—

subparagraph.name: B
x
subparagraph.leadIn: to authorize (with or without conditions) any person to collect or remove any chemical waste or clinical waste without a waste collection licence for that purpose if the Director opines that—

subparagraph.name: A

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of chemical waste, that notwithstanding that regulations relating thereto have come into operation, they or any provision thereof shall not apply to such waste until a day appointed by the Director by notice in the Gazette for the purpose and that he may appoint different days with reference to any chemical or substance prescribed under subsection (1)(e) or a chemical or substance which is included in or is a constituent or component of such chemical or substance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that any requirement to register imposed on a person pursuant to the regulations shall not apply to such persons and for such period or under such circumstances as may be prescribed. (Added 86 of 1991 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1)(j), regulations made under that subsection may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for different levels of charges to be payable for waste received at different facility, transfer, reception or disposal points or for waste delivered in different types of vehicle; (Amended 17 of 2004 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where any service referred to in that subsection is provided in response to an accident or emergency involving waste (and whether or not in consequence of the accident or emergency there is an imminent danger to any person or property), provide for different or additional charges than would be the case where any such service is provided otherwise than in response to such an accident or emergency;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: provide for the recovery of any charge (including any surcharge) prescribed under that subsection. (Added 14 of 1995 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations under this section may provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a contravention of any specified provision thereof; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to knowingly or recklessly provide incorrect or misleading information or omit material particulars or information or knowingly or recklessly certify as correct anything which is incorrect, in relation to any requirement in the regulations,

paragraph.continued: shall be an offence punishable with a fine not exceeding $200,000 and imprisonment not exceeding 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that if a person is convicted of an offence referred to in paragraph (a) and that offence is a continuing offence, such person shall, in addition to the penalties which may be imposed under that paragraph, be liable to a fine of $10,000 for each day on which the offence continues. (Replaced 86 of 1991 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations under this section may, in respect of any charge payable to the Director incurred or to be incurred under this Ordinance, provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director to authorize the deferral of payment of the charge for a period specified by the Director and, in that connection, to specify the security (if any) to be furnished to and received by the Director as guarantee for payment of the deferred charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment by the Director of a person to collect on the Director’s behalf the charge or any security referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: methods of the collection of the charge or security by the Director or by any person appointed under paragraph (b) and the manner in which a charge or security so collected should be accounted for. (Added 10 of 1997 s. 3)

def.leadIn: Regulations under this section may, as regards any premises used for or in connection with the collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception or disposal (including treatment, reprocessing or recycling) of waste (which activities are referred to in this subsection as relevant activities (有關活動))—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the regulation of traffic within, entering or leaving the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the safety of persons present in the premises;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: the prevention of any disruption to the operation of the premises or the carrying out of any relevant activity in the premises;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: measures to prevent or deter the commission of any offence under this Ordinance in or in relation to the premises;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: means of detecting the commission of any offence against this Ordinance in or in relation to the premises;

subparagraph.name: vii

paragraph.name: b
ba
paragraph.leadIn: confer on the Director the power—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to refuse to accept any waste at a designated waste disposal facility in such circumstances as the Director may think fit;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to determine whether a charge is to be imposed in respect of any waste or class of waste accepted for disposal at a waste disposal facility as may be prescribed by regulations made under this section;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to require any person who delivers any waste to a designated waste disposal facility to state the nature of the waste and give such other information as the Director may consider necessary to determine whether or not to accept the waste at that facility;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: to close temporarily any designated waste disposal facility for a specified period of time; (Added 17 of 2004 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: authorize the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
A
subparagraph.content: any person charged with carrying out or assisting in the carrying out of any relevant activity in such premises, or any person employed by such person; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any person charged with the collection of charges payable to the Director under this Ordinance or any person employed by such person,

subparagraph.continued: to exercise any of the powers conferred on the Director by regulations made under paragraph (b);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to give directions of a general character to any person such as is specified in subparagraph (i) in relation to the performance of functions or the exercise of powers vested by this Ordinance. (Added 10 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the disclosure by a third person of information concerning the identity of any person who, being the driver of a vehicle, is suspected of having committed an offence against this Ordinance and may provide for the admission into evidence in proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance of information so obtained as proof of the identity of the driver of a vehicle at the time of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may provide, for the purposes of any criminal proceedings under this Ordinance or any civil proceedings under this Ordinance, including proceedings for the recovery of any charge payable under this Ordinance, for the admission into evidence of any document—

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.content: purporting to be a record concerning such a device,

subsection.leadIn: If a Schedule to any regulations made under this section specifies—

paragraph.content: the fees for permits, authorizations or licences; or (Added 3 of 2016 s. 19)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the types of waste to be accepted at the premises for the disposal of waste,

subsection.content: If a Schedule to any regulations made under this section specifies the charges to be imposed in respect of any waste accepted for disposal at a waste disposal facility prescribed by the regulations, the regulations may provide that the Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule to revise the charges. (Added 25 of 2021 s. 7)
The Secretary may, under subsection (7), set the charges at above cost recovery level. (Added 25 of 2021 s. 7)

section.name: s34
section.heading: Advisory Council on the Environment
section.content: If any question arises as to who are the body of persons for the time being constituting the Advisory Council on the Environment mentioned in section 33 the matter shall be referred to the Chief Secretary for Administration who shall determine the question by certificate under his hand.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, prepare and revise Codes of Practice giving guidance and directions as to the collection, storage, treatment, transportation and disposal of waste. (Amended L.N. 244 of 1981; L.N. 370 of 1981; L.N. 18 of 1983; L.N. 165 of 1984; 58 of 1987 s. 12; L.N. 244 of 1989; L.N. 57 of 1994; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

A failure on the part of any person to observe any Code of Practice issued under subsection (1) shall not of itself render that person liable to criminal proceedings of any kind but any such failure may, in any proceedings whether civil or criminal and including proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, be relied upon as tending to establish or to negative any liability which is in question in those proceedings.
Subject to this section, this Ordinance shall bind the Government.

Sections 16, 17, 19 and 20 shall not have effect to permit proceedings to be taken against, or to impose any criminal liability on, the Government or any person who does any act which he is required to do in the course of carrying out his duties in the service of the Government.

If it appears to the Director that there has been a contravention of section 16, 17, 19 or 20 by any person in the course of carrying out his duties in the service of the Government, he shall, if the contravention is not forthwith terminated to his satisfaction, report the matter to the Chief Secretary for Administration. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 74 of 1986; L.N. 362 of 1997)

On receipt of a report under subsection (3) the Chief Secretary for Administration shall enquire into the circumstances and, if his enquiry shows that a contravention of section 16, 17, 19 or 20 is continuing or likely to recur, he shall ensure that the best practicable steps are taken to terminate the contravention or avoid the recurrence. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

Any notice or application under this Ordinance concerning a deposit or disposal of waste which is to be, or may be, given or made by or on behalf of the Government may be given or made by any public officer on behalf of the Government.

Any notice or application under this Ordinance concerning a deposit or discharge of waste which is to be, or may be, given to the Government shall be given to the principal officer of the appropriate waste disposal authority which appears to be responsible for the deposit or disposal or, in the event of any question arising as to which waste disposal authority is responsible, to such public officer as the Chief Secretary for Administration shall determine. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)
No fee or charge prescribed for the purposes of this Ordinance shall be payable by the Government.
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the First, Second, Third, Fourth and Fifth Schedules and Schedule 8. (Replaced 6 of 2006 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify as wastes that belong to Group 6 of Schedule 8 any wastes that, in his opinion—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are likely to be contaminated with infectious materials from patients falling within such case definition as specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may pose a significant health risk. (Replaced 6 of 2006 s. 21)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the list of pathogens listed in Group 4 of Schedule 8 and Schedules 10 and 11. (Added 6 of 2006 s. 21)

subsection.name: 2B

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b

section.name: s38
section.heading: Director to appoint dates for application of certain provisions

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding that by virtue of a notice under section 1(2)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: section 16 has come into operation, the prohibition therein against use of land or premises for the disposal of waste otherwise than under a licence shall not apply in relation to any waste; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 17 has come into operation, the provisions relating to notice or directions therein shall not apply in relation to waste of a class or description prescribed under section 33(1)(ea),

subsection.continued: until the day appointed by the Director by notice under subsection (2) in relation to such provision and to such class or description of waste specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by notice published in the Gazette appoint a day on and from which a provision referred to in subsection (1) shall apply in relation to waste of any class or description, including in the case of chemical waste a description by reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any chemical or substance prescribed under section 33(1)(e); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any chemical or substance included in or which is a component or constituent of such chemical or substance.

subsection.content: Where a person convicted of an offence under this Ordinance is a body corporate and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or any other person concerned in the management of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other person also commits the offence.

Where a person convicted of an offence under this Ordinance is a partner in a partnership and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, any other partner or any other person concerned in the management of the partnership, the partner or other person also commits the offence.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Evidence by certificate
section.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance or any regulations made under section 33, a certificate having attached thereto a map relating to any livestock premises in respect of which the offence is alleged to have been committed and purporting to be signed by the Director, an officer of the Environmental Protection Department not below the rank of Environmental Protection Officer or a Chief Environmental Protection Inspector and certifying that the livestock premises as shown on the map are within a livestock waste prohibition area, a livestock waste restriction area or a livestock waste control area, as the case may be, shall be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the contrary is proved it shall be presumed that the certificate was signed by the Director or such officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate and the map attached thereto shall be evidence of the facts contained therein.

subsection.content: Any draft waste disposal plan prepared or approved under a provision amended by the Provision of Municipal Services (Reorganization) Ordinance (Cap. 552) (Amending Ordinance) which is in force immediately before the amendments come into operation continues to have effect on and after such commencement as if prepared under the provision as amended by that Ordinance.

Any regulations made under a provision amended by the Amending Ordinance which are in force immediately before the amendments come into operation continue to be in force (subject to any amendments made by that Ordinance) as if made under the provision so amended and may be amended, repealed or replaced under the amended provision.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Recovery of charges and other sums by the Director as civil debts
section.leadIn: The following is recoverable by the Director as a civil debt due to the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any charge or surcharge payable under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount payable pursuant to an order made under section 18A(1)(b) or 23EA(2).

section.name: s43
section.heading: Payment to facility operator under agreement with Government

subsection.leadIn: Those parts or percentages of any charges imposed by any regulations made under section 33 which are required for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: settling a payment that a facility operator is entitled to receive under an agreement with the Government; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: clearing or closing any advance account opened for that purpose,

subsection.continued: shall, subject to the approval of the Financial Secretary, not form part of the general revenue and may, in the case of paragraph (a), be paid to the facility operator in accordance with the agreement.

subsection.def: For the purpose of subsection (1), facility operator (設施經營人) means a person who has entered into an agreement with the Government for the operation or management of a facility specified in Schedule 12.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Transitional provision relating to Waste Disposal (Amendment) Ordinance 2024

subsection.content: Section 20G(4), (5) and (6) of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply in respect of a person charged with an offence under section 20E for the import or export of e-waste that is not chemical waste, if the person commits the offence before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the specified date;
specified date (指明日期) means the date on which the Waste Disposal (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (29 of 2024) comes into operation*.
